languagepack.title: English (U.S.)
languagepack.string:

Kayako Desktop will use this number to determine the appropriate color for the tray icon based on visitor count in relation to this threshold.

Now synchronizing you with this conversation.
It appears that either %s has closed their chat window, or network problems have been encountered. The chat conversation has ended.

You have received a new message.
Click to view.

That canned response does not contain any actions!

Enter the email address(es) you wish to send the conversation to, separated by semicolons:
Enter your optional notes about the chat conversation. This will be sent as part of the email message:
The following invalid email address(es) were found:
Would you like to send the conversation anyways?
You must enter at least one email address.
You must enter at least one valid email address. To send the conversation to multiple people, separate their addresses with a semicolon (;)
Some of the settings you have changed require Kayako Desktop to be restarted before taking effect.
To reset all user prompts to their default states, press the 'Reset Prompts' button below.
All user prompts have been reset to their default states.
It is strongly recommended that you enable automatic product updates to ensure that you are always running the latest version of the software. Would you like to disable it anyway?

You have made changes to an account that you're currently connected to. To apply the changes, Kayako Desktop must disconnect from and then reconnect to this account.
Would you still like to apply the changes?
Are you sure you want to continue without adding an account?

You have chosen not to save the password for this account. You will be required to enter it manually each time you log in.
Do you still wish to continue?
Set a name for this account:
Enter the base URL of your server-side installation:
When automatically logging in, use this status:
Automatically log in to this account on startup
The following error(s) occurred when saving this account: %s
A password is required for the user %s on account %s:
Enable this option if you are running a server that doesn't support this header, such as lighttpd.
Use a &proxy to connect to the server
Prompt to &email conversation on session end
Auto Busy when I'm on the &phone
The value for 'auto-busy' must be between 1 and 100 chats.
The value for 'auto-away' must be between 1 and 300 minutes.
The chat event poll interval must be between 1 and 60 seconds.
Show tabs containing additional information related to phone calls when:
Always ring on default system speakers
An internal error occurred while trying to automatically detect your IP address. Please enter it manually instead.
The passive timeout must be between 1 and 5 minutes.
The pairing timeout must be between 1 and 60 seconds.
The port scan range must be between 1 and 65535.
The external port number must be between 1 and 65535.
The direct timeout must be between 30 and 3600 seconds.
In peer-to-peer mode, the passive timeout setting specifies the number of minutes that the OnSite viewer will wait for a peer to make a connection request before automatically canceling the session.

In peer-to-peer mode, the pairing timeout setting specifies the number of seconds that the OnSite viewer will wait after all proactive attempts to make a connection with the peer have failed. This allows any straggler connection requests from the peer to be properly handled.

In peer-to-peer mode, the port scan range setting specifies the number of ports above the peer's observed port that will be tried as part of the peer pairing operation.
It is recommended that this value be set to three (3).

In direct connection mode, the external IP/host name setting specifies the Internet-facing IP address (or host name) of your local network. This is usually the address of your router or gateway.
If you are not sure what value to use, try pushing the 'Autodetect' button.

In direct connection mode, the external port number setting specifies the port number on your Internet-facing interface (external IP/host name) that has been mapped to the OnSite viewer's port on your computer.
If you are not sure the port is properly forwarded, start the OnSite viewer in direct connection mode and then push the 'Test port' button on this window.
In Direct connection mode, the timeout value specifies how long to wait for the customer to connect before giving up.
The end user's operating system is not yet supported by OnSite.
Choose the method(s) you would like to use to connect with the customer's PC and then press Start to begin the session.
You must choose at least one connection mode.
Unable to start the OnSite session because the configuration file was not saved successfully. Error number %d
Unable to start the OnSite viewer application. Error number %d

You have enabled standard reverse connection, but the local IP address is not configured.
%s
Press OK to view OnSite settings.

When this connection method is selected, OnSite will attempt to establish a connection between your computer and the customer's computer without the need to do any advanced port forwarding or firewall configuration.
This method, however, depends on the hardware on both your network and the customer's. It is recommended to also enable direct connection as a fallback in case peer-to-peer is unsuccessful.

When this connection method is selected, OnSite will listen for connections much as a standard server. The customer's computer will then attempt to connect directly to your computer, which may require configuration of routers (port forwarding) and firewalls.
If you are unsure how to enable incoming connections from the Internet to your computer, contact your network administrator.
Kayako Desktop was unable to locate the OnSite application. You may need to reinstall Kayako Desktop.

Kayako Desktop was unable to start the OnSite application. (error: %d)
You may need to reinstall Kayako Desktop.

The 'time to live' must be between 5 seconds and 10 minutes (600 seconds)

The hotkey you entered has already been assigned to another action. If you continue, the previous action will be unassigned. Proceed?

This computer program is protected by copyright law and international treaties. Unauthorized reproduction or distribution of this program, or any portion of it, may result in severe civil and criminal penalties, and will be prosecuted to the maximum extent possible under the law.

We're sorry, Kayako Desktop encountered a serious problem and must shut down.
To help us diagnose and repair this problem, you can send a crash report. The crash report is only for debugging and contains no private or personal data.
If possible, provide steps to reproduce the problem:
Extended information is not required, but will usually make diagnosis much easier.

Directions:
Use your cursor to select the area you wish to capture. Hold the Ctrl key for extra precision.
To accept the selection press Enter, or press Esc to cancel.
